titleStmt.title: Reasons against a registry for lands, &c. shewing briefly, the great disadvantages, charges and inconveniences that may accrue to the whole nation in general thereby much over-ballancing the particular advantages that are imagined to arise therefrom : in answer to a late book entituled, Reasons for a registry : with some reasons for a registry of personal contracts humbly offered to consideration.

Reasons against a registry for lands, &c. shewing briefly, the great disadvantages, charges and inconveniences that may accrue to the whole nation in general thereby much over-ballancing the particular advantages that are imagined to arise therefrom : in answer to a late book entituled, Reasons for a registry : with some reasons for a registry of personal contracts humbly offered to consideration.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C. Wilkinson, and T. Burrel ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.

person.persName: Well-wisher to the publick interest of the nation.
